results.title: Chicago's modern architecture
results.creator_credit: Egons Tomsons, International Film Bureau and George Barford
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at Chicago’s modern architecture. Covers the Chicago school, modernism and post-modernism and shows the way in which the post modernists attempt to revive classical architectural features. Includes works by Sullivan, Richardson, Wright, Burnham and Root, Jeny, Van der Rohe, Yamasaki and Elmut Jahn.

results.title: Chiapas Army Base occupation (Mexico) Jan 1, 2001
results.brief_description: This astounding testimony to ‘the power of the people’ was given to the Memory Grid Community Collection as part of the SKA TV video compile ‘Global Insights 4’, a collection of shorts from around the world with a focus on grass-roots peoples’ action. Chiapas Army Base (Mexico) was filmed by Big Noise Tactical (USA) a not-for-profit, all-volunteer collective of media-makers around the world, ‘dedicated to circulating beautiful, passionate, revolutionary images.’

results.title: Chess
results.creator_credit: Salam Ziusudras, Film and Television Institute (WA) and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A humorous documentary style film with a dark edge to it about a refugee filmmaker’s transition from the brutality of the detention centre to adjusting and adapting to the Aussie way of life, fashion and culture. Contains disturbing images. Written, directed and produced by Salam Ziusudras

results.title: Cherith
results.creator_credit: Francine Penrose, AFTRS and Shirley Barrett
results.brief_description: Not being able to speak in tongues can be embarrassing at the very best of times. But if you are the only member of the congregation who cannot, and you are the daughter of a dynamic Revivalist preacher like Pastor Howard Spong - it’s even more distressing. And that’s just one of Cherith’s problems. This is a serious (and satirical) comedy about fundamentalist religion. This distinguished piece of film making , with a great script, direction and performance, won Best Short Fiction Film, AFI Awards in 1988.

results.title: Chemistry of soapless detergents
results.creator_credit: George Seager, De La Chevre Films, Unilever Films and Sam Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: Explains the molecular reaction between water and soapless detergent; molecules; research on the process of synthetization from petrol hydrocarbons. Laboratory demonstration of the production of Alkylbenzene sulphonate basis for a whole range of soapless detergent products for domestic use. Large scale production methods are also shown.

results.title: Chemistry in nature
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Film and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: This film attempts to correct the view that chemistry only takes place in the laboratory. Two examples from Japan are used showing a volcanic lake found to be the most acidic in the world and the spectacular production of sulphur from gases emitted by volcanic vents. An explanation of the processes involved is demonstrated using laboratory equipment in the field. Discussion pauses are provided. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Chemistry for sixth forms: catalysis
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, Associated Television and Phil Wrestler
results.brief_description: The term “catalysis” and its importance in industrial processes; homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis; catalytic cracking of petroleum; Faraday’s theory on the cause of surface catalysis; Sabatier-Senderens process using nickel as a catalyst in hydrogenation of vegetable oils; effect of poisons on surface catalysis; effect of manganese dioxide on hydrogen peroxide.

results.title: Chemistry and a changing world
results.brief_description: This film directs the student’s attention to the significance of chemistry in the modern world. It traces the steps leading up to the reproduction of electric furnace phosphorus. In showing the work of research chemists and chemical engineers who work from an original idea until it reaches its final form in the shape of a finished product, the film also provides information which may be of value in vocational guidance.
